  "Allegations" : "RESPONDENT DAVID HAVILAND, WHILE EMPLOYED WITH MERIT CAPITAL & ASSOCIATES, INC. TRANSACTED SECURITIES BUSINESS AS AN UNLICENSED AGENT OF A BROKER-DEALER, AND TRANSACTED INVESTMENT ADVISORY BUSINESS WITHOUT BEING LICENSED AS INVESTMENT ADVISOR IN THE STATE OF NH FROM MAY 1996 TO JULY 1997.",
  "Resolution" : "Consent",
  "SanctionDetails" : [ ],
  "Sanction Details" : "CONSENT AGREEMENT. RESPONDENT HAVILAND AGREED TO CERTAIN FINDINGS AND CONCLUSIONS OF LAW AND AGREED TO MAKE A CONTRIBUTION TO THE NH INVESTOR EDUCATION FUND IN THE AMOUNT OF $3,500.",
  "Broker Comment" : "MY FAILURE TO REGISTER IN NH FOR 7 MONTHS IN 1996 WAS DUE TO AN ADMINISTRATIVE OVERSIGHT BROUGHT ON BY THE FOLLOWING (1) MY PURCHASING THE BUSINESS. (2) TRANSITION OF THE BUSINESS FROM COMMISSION TO FEE BASED (3)BOTH CLIENTS MOVED FROM MASS TO NH IN EARLY 1997, NOW OPERATING AS AN RIA/ADVISORY AGENT. I WAS FULLY UNDER THE UNDERSTANDING THAT THE DE MINIMIS SIGNED INTO LAW IN OCTOBER 1996, IN THE NATIONAL SECURITIES MARKET IMPROVEMENT ACT OF 1996 EXEMPTED ME FROM NEEDING TO REGISTER IN NH.  HOWEVER, THIS LAW DID NOT TAKE EFFECT UNTIL JULY 8, 1997 AND THUS I WAS FOUND TO BE IN TECHNICAL VIOLATION. BOTH H & CO AND I WERE IN FULL COMPLIANCE ON OUR OWN ACCORD WHEN THE OVERSIGHTS WERE DISCOVERED IN 1998."
